What is the purpose of the `z_exportwallet` command in Verus?
The `z_exportwallet` command is used to export all wallet keys, including both transparent (taddr) and private (zaddr) addresses, in a human-readable format.

z_exportwallet "filename" (omitemptytaddresses)

Exports all wallet keys, for taddr and zaddr, in a human-readable format. Overwriting an existing file is not permitted.

Arguments:
1. "filename"      (string, required) The filename, saved in folder set by verusd -exportdir option
2. "omitemptytaddresses" (boolean, optional) Defaults to false. If true, export only addresses with indexed UTXOs or that control IDs in the wallet
                        (do not use this option without being sure that all addresses of interest are included)

Result:
"path"      (string) The full path of the destination file

Examples:
> verus z_exportwallet "test"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "z_exportwallet", "params": ["test"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/z_exportwallet
What are the required and optional arguments for the `z_exportwallet` command?

The required argument is "filename", which is a string specifying the filename where the wallet keys will be saved. The optional argument is "omitemptytaddresses", which is a boolean that defaults to false. If set to true, the command will only export addresses with indexed UTXOs or that control IDs in the wallet.

What is the default behavior of the `z_exportwallet` command regarding addresses with no indexed UTXOs or controlling IDs?

By default, the `z_exportwallet` command will export all wallet keys, including addresses with no indexed UTXOs or controlling IDs. However, if the "omitemptytaddresses" option is set to true, the command will only export addresses with indexed UTXOs or that control IDs in the wallet.

How can I use the `z_exportwallet` command to export my wallet keys?

You can use the `z_exportwallet` command by running `verus z_exportwallet "filename"` in your terminal, replacing "filename" with the desired name for your export file. Alternatively, you can use the Verus RPC interface to call the `z_exportwallet` method, as shown in the example using `curl`.
